name: Unity
body:
Installation

Install the package via the Unity Package Manager using a Git URL to Sentry's SDK repository:

https://github.com/getsentry/unity.git#1.8.0

Configuration

The Unity SDK now supports line numbers for IL2CPP. The feature is currently in beta, but you can enable it at Tools -> Sentry -> Advanced -> IL2CPP line numbers. To learn more check out our docs.

Access the Sentry configuration window by going to Unity's top menu: Tools > Sentry and enter the following

DSNThe Data Source Name (DSN) key tells the Sentry SDK where to send events, ensuring they go to the right project.
:

___PUBLIC_DSN___

And that's it! Now Sentry can capture errors automatically.

If you like additional contexts you could enable Screenshots.

Verify

Once it is configured with the

DSNThe Data Source Name (DSN) key tells the Sentry SDK where to send events, ensuring they go to the right project.
you can call the SDK from anywhere:

using Sentry; // On the top of the script

SentrySdk.CaptureMessage("Test event");

Troubleshooting

Confirm the URL doesn't have a trailing whitespace at the end. The Unity Package Manager will fail to find the package if a trailing whitespace is appended.

If you're running into any kind of issue please check out our troubleshooting page or raise an issue.
